items.sentence: You should let Tom know you have to do that.
You ought to let Tom know you can't do that.
You ought to let Tom know Mary will do that.
You know that Tom isn't a barber, don't you?
You know Tom is still a bachelor, don't you?
You know Tom is in love with you, don't you?
We should be arriving in Boston around 2:30.
Tom was one of the best players on the team.
Tom has been in the pool almost all morning.
Tom has got to be at least thirty years old.
Tom has really been looking forward to this.
Tom refuses to buy anything made of leather.
Tom buys all his clothes right off the rack.
Tom and I have to buy our tickets right now.
Do you think Tom believed what you told him?
Do you have any idea why Tom gave it to you?
Tom took a piece of pie and began eating it.
Have you given Tom anything to eat or drink?
Tom put the money Mary gave him in the bank.
Tom plans to put new locks on all the doors.
